Description: Heart scarab with a human head and seriated elytra separated from the plain prothorax by a single perpendicular line. The scarab's legs were carefully carved on the side. The base is inscribed with nine lines of hieroglyphs (spell 30B of the Book of the Dead). Two small holes were pieced on each side.
Curator's comments: For close parallels, see G. Steindorff, Aniba II, pl. 49-50
